overview.title: Overview
overview.description: The SAT Math section assesses high school-level mathematical skills needed for college success. The test covers four areas: Algebra (13-15 questions), Advanced Math (13-15 questions), Problem Solving and Data Analysis (5-7 questions), and Geometry and Trigonometry (5-7 questions). Like the Reading and Writing section, Math is divided into two modules. Questions include multiple-choice and student-produced responses, assessing fluency, understanding, and application of essential math concepts. Questions from all categories appear in each module and are arranged from easiest to hardest.

practice.title: Practice
practice.description: Interactive practices to help you build the foundations.
